subject: Communication
title: Mirror Neurons and Unconscious Mimicry
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Mirror Neurons and Unconscious Mimicry.

hook.text: Your friend yawns. You yawn. Nobody decided this. Your brain copied the action without permission.

buildup.text: Mirror neurons fire both when we perform an action and when we observe someone else performing it.

discovery.text: Discovered in macaque monkeys in the 1990s, mirror neurons may underpin empathy and social bonding.

twist.text: We unconsciously mimic people we like â€” their posture, gestures, and expressions. It's called the chameleon effect.

climax.text: Mimicry builds rapport without words. People who are mimicked rate interactions as more positive.

punchline.text: We connect by copying. It's not flattery â€” it's biology.
